One of the few silver linings to emerge from the most recent global health crisis in the growing prevalence of the telehealth business platform.

What exactly is telehealth, and how can your healthcare enterprise use this emerging technology to improve patient outcomes, improve services, and offer world-class healthcare from anywhere in the world?

TeleDirect’s business process outsourcing (BPO) platform, a reliable asset for non-healthcare entities for years, is also a go-to solutions provider for the entire healthcare industry, thanks to our rock-solid, HIPAA-compliant data protocols, reliable customer service, and inbound & outbound services.

Let’s look more closely at what is telehealth, and how telehealth call center services can take your patient care to the next level, whether you’re a small practice or worldwide healthcare provider.

 

What is Telehealth?

Telehealth services include any healthcare service delivered remotely, as opposed to the traditional patient-in-office scenario. Telehealth call center service can include:

  • Live video discussions with doctors and patients
  • Remote medical monitoring, including everything from cardiology services to sleep apnea treatments & more
  • Secure messages between patients and health care providers

Telehealth business services comprise everything structured around these arrangements, including medical appointment reservations, customer & patient service, and even healthcare product & service promotional activities to give your patients complete healthcare coverage.
